intro: Aquilegia atrata var. pseudoeinseleana, commonly known as the dark red columbine, is a hybrid form of the genus Aquilegia, characterized by its striking deep red to maroon petals. It is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, where it thrives in rocky and well-drained soils. The plant features showy, spurred flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are palmately compound, with finely divided lobes, and it typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm. Due to its ornamental value and rarity, it is often cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
